required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Mitopure Challenge to Detect Levels of Urolithin A in Dried Blood Spots
clinical_study.official_title: Open-labelled Study to Validate Home-based Use of a Health and Wellness Kit (The Mitopure Challenge) to Detect Levels of Urolithin A in Dried Blood Spots After Intake of Mitopure (Proprietary Urolithin A)

brief_summary.textblock: Open labelled, virtual home based study to assess the test repeatability and the failure/rejection rate of the samples collected at home by participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Failure/rejection rate (% of the samples) collected at home by participants.
primary_outcome.description: Acceptability target goal is to hit 80% of analyzed samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity (% of the samples) of the analytical method developed to test Urolithin A in dry blood spots.
Fold change increase in the levels of UA-Glucuronide (in ng/mL) in the dried blood spots provided in the kit before and after the challenge
Validation of a health questionnaire on participants health status

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake
arm_group.description: Mitopure challenge with diet (Pomegranate juice- Before) followed by Mitopure supplementation (After) to compare levels in blood spots of UA-Glucuronide (in ng/mL)

intervention.description: Fruit flavored sachet containing fixed dose of Mitopureâ„¢ (Proprietary Urolithin A)
intervention.arm_group_label: Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake
Mitopure Challenge to assess blood levels of Urolithin A after dietary and Mitopure intake

reference.citation: Singh A, D'Amico D, Andreux PA, Dunngalvin G, Kern T, Blanco-Bose W, Auwerx J, Aebischer P, Rinsch C. Direct supplementation with Urolithin A overcomes limitations of dietary exposure and gut microbiome variability in healthy adults to achieve consistent levels across the population. Eur J Clin Nutr. 2021 Jun 11. doi: 10.1038/s41430-021-00950-1. [Epub ahead of print]
